org.deri.tarql

Class CSVOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.deri.tarql.CSVOptions

  • public class CSVOptions
extends java.lang.Object
    Configuration options for describing a CSV file. Also provides convenience functions for creating Readers and CSVParsers based on these options.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  CSVOptions.ParseResult
      Helper class for the result of parseIRI(iri)

      static CSVOptions.ParseResult parseIRI(java.lang.String iri)
      Extracts a CSVOptions object from the fragment part of a CSV file URL, e.g., http://example.com/file.csv#encoding=utf-8;header=absent The remainder of the URL, with anything interpretable removed, can also be obtained from the returned parse result.

      • CSVOptions

        public CSVOptions()
        Creates a new instance with default values.

      • CSVOptions

    • Method Detail

      • parseIRI

        public static CSVOptions.ParseResult parseIRI(java.lang.String iri)
        Extracts a CSVOptions object from the fragment part of a CSV file URL, e.g., http://example.com/file.csv#encoding=utf-8;header=absent The remainder of the URL, with anything interpretable removed, can also be obtained from the returned parse result.

      • parseChar

        private static java.lang.Character parseChar(java.lang.String value)
        Interprets argument as a character. Can be a literal single-character string, or a %-encoded character (e.g., %09 for tab), or one of the pre-defined named characters such as "tab", "backslash", etc.

      • overrideWith

        public void overrideWith(CSVOptions other)
        Override values in this object with those from the other. Anything that is null in the other object will be ignored.

      • setEncoding

        public void setEncoding(java.lang.String encoding)
        Specify the CSV file's character encoding. null signifies unknown encoding, that is, auto-detection. The default is null.

      • getEncoding

        public java.lang.String getEncoding()
        Returns the CSV file's character encoding, or null if unknown.

      • setColumnNamesInFirstRow

        public void setColumnNamesInFirstRow(java.lang.Boolean value)
        Set whether the CSV file's first row contains column names. null means unknown. The default is null.

      • hasColumnNamesInFirstRow

        public java.lang.Boolean hasColumnNamesInFirstRow()
        Set whether the CSV file's first row contains column names. null means unknown. The default is null.

      • setDelimiter

        public void setDelimiter(java.lang.Character delimiter)
        Sets the delimiter between entries. null means unknown.

      • getDelimiter

        public java.lang.Character getDelimiter()
        Gets the delimiter between entries. null means unknown.

      • setQuoteChar

        public void setQuoteChar(java.lang.Character quote)
        Sets the quote character used in the file. null means unknown.

      • getQuoteChar

        public java.lang.Character getQuoteChar()
        Gets the quote character used in the file. null means unknown.

      • setEscapeChar

        public void setEscapeChar(java.lang.Character escape)
        Sets the escape character used in the file to escape quotes. null means no escape character, and quotes inside quoted values are escaped as two quote characters.

      • getEscapeChar

        public java.lang.Character getEscapeChar()
        Gets the escape character used in the file to escape quotes. null means no escape character, and quotes inside quoted values are escaped as two quote characters.

      • openParserFor

        public CSVParser openParserFor(InputStreamSource source)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new CSVParser for a given InputStreamSource with the options of this instance.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

        public java.io.Reader openReaderFor(InputStreamSource source)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new Reader for a given InputStreamSource with the options of this instance.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
